Query.SqlString: SELECT Top 32767 ID,Literature FROM Literature WHERE (Literature ='SA00')

BibliographicData.Title: Topographic organization of cortical inputs to the lateral nucleus of the macaque monkey amygdala: A retrograde tracing study

BrainSite.FullName: Accessory basal (magnocellular) nucleus of the amygdala
Accessory basal amygdaloid nucleus, parvicellular part
areas 35, 36d, 36r, and 36c of the perirhinal cortex
Nucleus of the lateral olfactory tract
Area TEO plus more caudally placed visual association areas

Reference.Quotation: "Thirty-five fluorescent tracer injections were deposited in the amygdaloid complex. Twenty-three of these included the lateral nucleus (Fig. 2), whereas the remainder of the injections were located in the other amygdaloid nuclei or outside of the amygdaloid complex. Although some of the lateral nucleus injections extended across nuclear borders (to the claustrum, external capsule, or the parvicellular division of the basal nucleus), the majority were confined to the lateral nucleus. Of these, three were located in the dorsal subdivision (M-10-92R, M13-92L, M29-92L), five were located in the dorsal intermediate subdivision (M7-92L, M8-92R, M12-92L, M28-92R, M30-92R), three were located in the ventral intermediate subdivision (M10-92L, M27-92L, M31-92R), and two were located in the ventral subdivision (M8-92L, M27-92R). In addition, four injections involved two subdivisions (Ld/Ldi, M29-92R; Ldi/Lvi, M12-92R; Ldi/Lv, M3-92L; Lvi/Lv, M4-93L). Figure 3 shows the locations of the fluorescent dye deposits for four experiments. In each experiment, the dye deposit was located in a different lateral nucleus subdivision (Fig. 3A, M13-92L, dorsal subdivision; Fig. 3B, M12-92L, dorsal intermediate subdivision; Fig. 3C, M10-92L, ventral intermediate subdivision; Fig. 3D, M8-92L, ventral subdivision). Figure 4A shows a fluorescence photomicrograph of the dye deposit for an additional experiment (M27-92R)." (pp. 55, 58).

Reference.Comments: table 1 says that there were no labeled cells found in area TEO#, but figure 11B shows label in area TEO#

Reference.Quotation: "Thirty-five fluorescent tracer injections were deposited in the amygdaloid complex. Twenty-three of these included the lateral nucleus (Fig. 2), whereas the remainder of the injections were located in the other amygdaloid nuclei or outside of the amygdaloid complex. Although some of the lateral nucleus injections extended across nuclear borders (to the claustrum, external capsule, or the parvicellular division of the basal nucleus), the majority were confined to the lateral nucleus. Of these, three were located in the dorsal subdivision (M-10-92R, M13-92L, M29-92L), five were located in the dorsal intermediate subdivision (M7-92L, M8-92R, M12-92L, M28-92R, M30-92R), three were located in the ventral intermediate subdivision (M10-92L, M27-92L, M31-92R), and two were located in the ventral subdivision (M8-92L, M27-92R). In addition, four injections involved two subdivisions (Ld/Ldi, M29-92R; Ldi/Lvi, M12-92R; Ldi/Lv, M3-92L; Lvi/Lv, M4-93L). Figure 3 shows the locations of the fluorescent dye deposits for four experiments. In each experiment, the dye deposit was located in a different lateral nucleus subdivision (Fig. 3A, M13-92L, dorsal subdivision; Fig. 3B, M12-92L, dorsal intermediate subdivision; Fig. 3C, M10-92L, ventral intermediate subdivision; Fig. 3D, M8-92L, ventral subdivision). Figure 4A shows a fluorescence photomicrograph of the dye deposit for an additional experiment (M27-92R)." (pp. 55, 58).
